terrapeer.vui.j3dui.utils.app
Class AppDisplay

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Canvas
          javax.media.j3d.Canvas3D
              terrapeer.vui.j3dui.utils.app.AppDisplay
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class AppDisplay
extends javax.media.j3d.Canvas3D

This class represents a view's "display space" and the internal geometry associated with the display and its screen. It must be added to the application frame in order to see its associated view of the virtual world. It also provides image capture support through getImage(), such as for printing.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

AppDisplay

public AppDisplay(java.awt.GraphicsConfiguration gc)
Constructs a new AppDisplay(). Must be associated with an AppView in order to use it.

Method Detail

getDisplaySize

public javax.vecmath.Tuple2d getDisplaySize(javax.vecmath.Tuple2d size)
Gets the display window size in pixels. The display canvas must be live for this to work.

Parameters:
size - Size Return display size.
Returns:
Reference to the display size.

getScreenSize

Gets the screen size in pixels.

size - Return screen size.
Returns:

getScreenResolution

public javax.vecmath.Tuple2d getScreenResolution(javax.vecmath.Tuple2d res)
Gets the screen resolution in pixels per meter.

Parameters:
res - Return screen resolution.
Returns:
Reference to the screen resolution.

getImage

public java.awt.Image getImage()
Gets a snapshot image of the current display. MUST be called from a separate thread otherwise the canvas will become frozen. Also, ONLY works for the first display added to the frame (bug in Canvas3D?).

Returns:
New image captured from the display.

getMinimumSize

public java.awt.Dimension getMinimumSize()

postSwap

public void postSwap()
Called by the renderer. Do not use this method directly, instead use getImage() to coordinate everything and to get the image.

preRender

public void preRender()
Called by the renderer. Do not use this method directly. Implements change poster notification after all scenegraph changes have been presumably completed.
